name: emphysematous change
description: A pathological change in the lung tissue caused by emphysema, characterized by the enlargement of air spaces distal to the terminal bronchioles and destruction of alveolar walls

attributes.name: severity
attributes.description: The extent or seriousness of the emphysematous change

values.name: severe
values.description: Of a great or serious extent or degree

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The specific pattern of emphysematous change

values.name: centrilobular
values.description: Involving the central part of the lobule, typically associated with smoking

values.name: paraseptal
values.description: Involving the outer parts of the lobule, near the pleura

values.name: panlobular
values.description: Involving the entire lobule, typically seen in alpha-1 antitrypsin deficiency

values.name: centrilobular and paraseptal
values.description: Combined features of centrilobular and paraseptal emphysema

attributes.name: location
attributes.description: The anatomical region of the emphysematous change

values.name: upper lobes
values.description: The upper portion of the lungs

values.name: lower lobes
values.description: The lower portion of the lungs

values.name: bilateral
values.description: Both the left and right lungs

examples.report_text: Emphysematous lung changes are severe. Persistent extensive mucous plugging within bilateral lower lobe bronchi.
Upper lobes show mild emphysematous change.
Emphysematous changes of centrilobular and paraseptal type are detected. No consolidation present.
Centrilobular emphysematous changes observed. Small amount of mucus in the trachea.
3.  Stable background of centrilobular and paraseptal emphysematous changes with bronchial wall thickening, mucus plugging, bronchiectasis.

There is a relatively avascular areas in keeping with panlobular emphysema.   There is posterior basal segmental right lower lobar bronchiectatic change, not significantly changed.   No consolidation. The airways are clear.
